channel.title: Ubuntu Installation?
channel.description:
Hello there I am stuck and would like some help installing on Ubuntu 64 bit.
I downloaded Archive Manager. Unzipped it.
I try to click on Bitbay.sh nothing happens, I try to run it on terminal nothing happens.
Can you please help? Thank you!

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @dzimbeck David Zimbeck
item.description:
@dzimbeck wrote:

We will update pyelliptic soon and test on some of the newer Linux platforms. SSL was updated and maybe some Linux requires newer versions.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @eisyeisy
item.description:
@eisyeisy wrote:

The installation on Ubuntu does not work for me. I have already tried everything. Unfortunately I can’t get any further. Does anyone understand that?

Fontconfig error: “/etc/fonts/conf.d/10-scale-bitmap-fonts.conf”, line 72: non-double matrix element

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @XxOtakuXx
item.description:
@XxOtakuXx wrote:

Open a Terminal in BitBay folder directory and use ‘‘bash BitBay.sh’’

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @Craig Craig
item.description:
@Craig wrote:

Toknormal did verify that the build from source guide did work fine with his Ubuntu

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @dzimbeck David Zimbeck
item.description:
@dzimbeck wrote:

It’s worth pointing out that there is a 32 and 64 bit build packaged. Double check you are running the right one. And like GiorgosK pointed out please run it from command line.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Installation?
item.dc:creator: @GiorgosK Giorgos Kontopoulos
item.description:
@GiorgosK wrote:

Your system probably missing libraries
try to run it from command line to see error message

I am going to get someone that know ubuntu well to give you more feedback

if you are good with command line you can alternatively build QT wallet from source

BitBay Community

How to build the BitBay QT from Source

Linux QT wallet install for Debian Jessie n.b. this does not work for Stretch at the moment and hasn’t been tried in ubuntu. To start: Go here to set up your super user Then here for referrence Then follow these commands in terminal sudo...

Read full topic
